title: The Hurley Headshot System: A 7-Step Process
summary: Photographer Peter Hurley outlines his 7-step workflow for capturing professional headshots, emphasizing the importance of body positioning, grooming checks, and eliciting genuine facial expressions.

steps.action: Position the body. The photographer should act as a mirror to guide the subject into the correct stance.
Position the head. Instruct the subject to freeze their body and move their head and neck independently.
Perform a hair and clothing scan. Physically step in to fix stray hairs or adjust clothing if necessary.
Compose the shot. Re-frame the camera angle to account for the subject's adjustments.
Add stimuli that elicits a facial reaction. Use conversation or direction to provoke a genuine expression.
Fire at will. Capture the images immediately once the desired reaction is achieved.
Repeat the system. Start the process over from step one for subsequent shots.

key_takeaways: The photographer must mirror the subject to effectively communicate body positioning.
Head movements should be isolated from body movements to maintain the pose.
Scanning for hair and clothing issues is a critical step that must happen before shooting.
Eliciting a reaction through verbal stimuli is the most important part of the system.
The entire 7-step process is designed to be a split-second pre-shutter checklist.
